42#ifdef __NetBSD__
43/* XXX argh argh argh argh argh argh argh argh */
44static bool mutex_is_locked_by(struct mutex *mutex, struct proc *proc)
45{
46
47 KASSERT(proc == curproc);
48 /* Actually answers `do we own mutex?'. */
49 return mutex_is_locked(mutex);
50}
51#else
52static bool mutex_is_locked_by(struct mutex *mutex, struct task_struct *task)
53{
54 if (!mutex_is_locked(mutex))
55 return false;
56
57#if defined(CONFIG_DEBUG_MUTEXES) || defined(CONFIG_MUTEX_SPIN_ON_OWNER)
58 return mutex->owner == task;
59#else
60 /* Since UP may be pre-empted, we cannot assume that we own the lock */
61 return false;
62#endif
63}
64#endif
65
66/**
67 * i915_gem_shrink - Shrink buffer object caches
68 * @dev_priv: i915 device
69 * @target: amount of memory to make available, in pages
70 * @flags: control flags for selecting cache types
71 *
72 * This function is the main interface to the shrinker. It will try to release
73 * up to @target pages of main memory backing storage from buffer objects.
74 * Selection of the specific caches can be done with @flags. This is e.g. useful
75 * when purgeable objects should be removed from caches preferentially.
76 *
77 * Note that it's not guaranteed that released amount is actually available as
78 * free system memory - the pages might still be in-used to due to other reasons
79 * (like cpu mmaps) or the mm core has reused them before we could grab them.
80 * Therefore code that needs to explicitly shrink buffer objects caches (e.g. to
81 * avoid deadlocks in memory reclaim) must fall back to i915_gem_shrink_all().
82 *
83 * Also note that any kind of pinning (both per-vma address space pins and
84 * backing storage pins at the buffer object level) result in the shrinker code
85 * having to skip the object.
86 *
87 * Returns:
88 * The number of pages of backing storage actually released.
89 */
90unsigned long
91i915_gem_shrink(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
92 unsigned long target, unsigned flags)
93{
94 const struct {
95 struct list_head *list;
96 unsigned int bit;
97 } phases[] = {
98 { &dev_priv->mm.unbound_list, I915_SHRINK_UNBOUND },
99 { &dev_priv->mm.bound_list, I915_SHRINK_BOUND },
100 { NULL, 0 },
101 }, *phase;
102 unsigned long count = 0;
103
104 trace_i915_gem_shrink(dev_priv, target, flags);
105 i915_gem_retire_requests(dev_priv->dev);
106
107 /*
108 * As we may completely rewrite the (un)bound list whilst unbinding
109 * (due to retiring requests) we have to strictly process only
110 * one element of the list at the time, and recheck the list
111 * on every iteration.
112 *
113 * In particular, we must hold a reference whilst removing the
114 * object as we may end up waiting for and/or retiring the objects.
115 * This might release the final reference (held by the active list)
116 * and result in the object being freed from under us. This is
117 * similar to the precautions the eviction code must take whilst
118 * removing objects.
119 *
120 * Also note that although these lists do not hold a reference to
121 * the object we can safely grab one here: The final object
122 * unreferencing and the bound_list are both protected by the
123 * dev->struct_mutex and so we won't ever be able to observe an
124 * object on the bound_list with a reference count equals 0.
125 */
126 for (phase = phases; phase->list; phase++) {
127 struct list_head still_in_list;
128
129 if ((flags & phase->bit) == 0)
130 continue;
131
132 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&still_in_list);
133 while (count < target && !list_empty(phase->list)) {
134 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
135 struct i915_vma *vma, *v;
136
137 obj = list_first_entry(phase->list,
138 typeof(*obj), global_list);
139 list_move_tail(&obj->global_list, &still_in_list);
140
141 if (flags & I915_SHRINK_PURGEABLE &&
142 obj->madv != I915_MADV_DONTNEED)
143 continue;
144
145 if ((flags & I915_SHRINK_ACTIVE) == 0 && obj->active)
146 continue;
147
148 drm_gem_object_reference(&obj->base);
149
150 /* For the unbound phase, this should be a no-op! */
151 list_for_each_entry_safe(vma, v,
152 &obj->vma_list, vma_link)
153 if (i915_vma_unbind(vma))
154 break;
155
156 if (i915_gem_object_put_pages(obj) == 0)
157 count += obj->base.size >> PAGE_SHIFT;
158
159 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
160 }
161 list_splice(&still_in_list, phase->list);
162 }
163
164 i915_gem_retire_requests(dev_priv->dev);
165
166 return count;
167}
168
169/**
170 * i915_gem_shrink_all - Shrink buffer object caches completely
171 * @dev_priv: i915 device
172 *
173 * This is a simple wraper around i915_gem_shrink() to aggressively shrink all
174 * caches completely. It also first waits for and retires all outstanding
175 * requests to also be able to release backing storage for active objects.
176 *
177 * This should only be used in code to intentionally quiescent the gpu or as a
178 * last-ditch effort when memory seems to have run out.
179 *
180 * Returns:
181 * The number of pages of backing storage actually released.
182 */
183unsigned long i915_gem_shrink_all(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
184{
185 return i915_gem_shrink(dev_priv, -1UL,
186 I915_SHRINK_BOUND |
187 I915_SHRINK_UNBOUND |
188 I915_SHRINK_ACTIVE);
189}
190
191static bool i915_gem_shrinker_lock(struct drm_device *dev, bool *unlock)
192{
193 if (!mutex_trylock(&dev->struct_mutex)) {
194 if (!mutex_is_locked_by(&dev->struct_mutex, current))
195 return false;
196
197 if (to_i915(dev)->mm.shrinker_no_lock_stealing)
198 return false;
199
200 *unlock = false;
201 } else
202 *unlock = true;
203
204 return true;
205}
206
207static int num_vma_bound(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj)
208{
209 struct i915_vma *vma;
210 int count = 0;
211
212 list_for_each_entry(vma, &obj->vma_list, vma_link) {
213 if (drm_mm_node_allocated(&vma->node))
214 count++;
215 if (vma->pin_count)
216 count++;
217 }
218
219 return count;
220}
221
222static unsigned long
223i915_gem_shrinker_count(struct shrinker *shrinker, struct shrink_control *sc)
224{
225 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv =
226 container_of(shrinker, struct drm_i915_private, mm.shrinker);
227 struct drm_device *dev = dev_priv->dev;
228 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
229 unsigned long count;
230 bool unlock;
231
232 if (!i915_gem_shrinker_lock(dev, &unlock))
233 return 0;
234
235 count = 0;
236 list_for_each_entry(obj, &dev_priv->mm.unbound_list, global_list)
237 if (obj->pages_pin_count == 0)
238 count += obj->base.size >> PAGE_SHIFT;
239
240 list_for_each_entry(obj, &dev_priv->mm.bound_list, global_list) {
241 if (!obj->active && obj->pages_pin_count == num_vma_bound(obj))
242 count += obj->base.size >> PAGE_SHIFT;
243 }
244
245 if (unlock)
246 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
247
248 return count;
249}
250
251static unsigned long
252i915_gem_shrinker_scan(struct shrinker *shrinker, struct shrink_control *sc)
253{
254 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv =
255 container_of(shrinker, struct drm_i915_private, mm.shrinker);
256 struct drm_device *dev = dev_priv->dev;
257 unsigned long freed;
258 bool unlock;
259
260 if (!i915_gem_shrinker_lock(dev, &unlock))
261 return SHRINK_STOP;
262
263 freed = i915_gem_shrink(dev_priv,
264 sc->nr_to_scan,
265 I915_SHRINK_BOUND |
266 I915_SHRINK_UNBOUND |
267 I915_SHRINK_PURGEABLE);
268 if (freed < sc->nr_to_scan)
269 freed += i915_gem_shrink(dev_priv,
270 sc->nr_to_scan - freed,
271 I915_SHRINK_BOUND |
272 I915_SHRINK_UNBOUND);
273 if (unlock)
274 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
275
276 return freed;
277}
278
279static int
280i915_gem_shrinker_oom(struct notifier_block *nb, unsigned long event, void *ptr)
281{
282 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv =
283 container_of(nb, struct drm_i915_private, mm.oom_notifier);
284 struct drm_device *dev = dev_priv->dev;
285 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
286 unsigned long timeout = msecs_to_jiffies(5000) + 1;
287 unsigned long pinned, bound, unbound, freed_pages;
288 bool was_interruptible;
289 bool unlock;
290
291 while (!i915_gem_shrinker_lock(dev, &unlock) && --timeout) {
292#ifdef __NetBSD__
293 int error = kpause("i915shnk", true, 1, NULL);
294 if (error == EINTR || error == ERESTART)
295 return NOTIFY_DONE;
296#else
297 schedule_timeout_killable(1);
298 if (fatal_signal_pending(current))
299 return NOTIFY_DONE;
300#endif
301 }
302 if (timeout == 0) {
303 pr_err("Unable to purge GPU memory due lock contention.\n");
304 return NOTIFY_DONE;
305 }
306
307 was_interruptible = dev_priv->mm.interruptible;
308 dev_priv->mm.interruptible = false;
309
310 freed_pages = i915_gem_shrink_all(dev_priv);
311
312 dev_priv->mm.interruptible = was_interruptible;
313
314 /* Because we may be allocating inside our own driver, we cannot
315 * assert that there are no objects with pinned pages that are not
316 * being pointed to by hardware.
317 */
318 unbound = bound = pinned = 0;
319 list_for_each_entry(obj, &dev_priv->mm.unbound_list, global_list) {
320 if (!obj->base.filp) /* not backed by a freeable object */
321 continue;
322
323 if (obj->pages_pin_count)
324 pinned += obj->base.size;
325 else
326 unbound += obj->base.size;
327 }
328 list_for_each_entry(obj, &dev_priv->mm.bound_list, global_list) {
329 if (!obj->base.filp)
330 continue;
331
332 if (obj->pages_pin_count)
333 pinned += obj->base.size;
334 else
335 bound += obj->base.size;
336 }
337
338 if (unlock)
339 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
340
341 if (freed_pages || unbound || bound)
342 pr_info("Purging GPU memory, %lu bytes freed, %lu bytes still pinned.\n",
343 freed_pages << PAGE_SHIFT, pinned);
344 if (unbound || bound)
345 pr_err("%lu and %lu bytes still available in the "
346 "bound and unbound GPU page lists.\n",
347 bound, unbound);
348
349 *(unsigned long *)ptr += freed_pages;
350 return NOTIFY_DONE;
351}
352
353/**
354 * i915_gem_shrinker_init - Initialize i915 shrinker
355 * @dev_priv: i915 device
356 *
357 * This function registers and sets up the i915 shrinker and OOM handler.
358 */
359void i915_gem_shrinker_init(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
360{
361 dev_priv->mm.shrinker.scan_objects = i915_gem_shrinker_scan;
362 dev_priv->mm.shrinker.count_objects = i915_gem_shrinker_count;
363 dev_priv->mm.shrinker.seeks = DEFAULT_SEEKS;
364 register_shrinker(&dev_priv->mm.shrinker);
365
366 dev_priv->mm.oom_notifier.notifier_call = i915_gem_shrinker_oom;
367 register_oom_notifier(&dev_priv->mm.oom_notifier);
368}
